entry.title: FOSSX Mountain Lion: OSX Setup For The FOSS Mind
entry.content:
I’ve recently had to convert from Linux to OSX as my main workstation. This will be a collection of steps it takes to make OSX suitable for the FOSS mind.

mkdir $HOME/.homebrew && curl -L https://github.com/mxcl/homebrew/tarball/master | tar xz --strip 1 -C $HOME/.homebrew

// export PATHs

brew install git
brew install --disableetc zsh

brew install vim

# Adapted from:
# http://thomasrieder.github.io/blog/2012/09/23/octopress-and-mountain-lion/
curl -L https://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable
rvm pkg install iconv
rvm install 1.9.3 --with-gcc=clang --with-iconv-dir=$rvm_path/usr
rvm use 1.9.3

git clone git://github.com/<yourUser>/<yourOctopress>.git Projects/blog
cd Projects/blog
gem install bundler
bundle install

git checkout -b source origin/source
rake setup_github_pages

# if you have custom domain fix your _config.yml as setup_github_pages
# changes your domain there to the github.io domain
# vim _config.yml
